recipe.ingredients: - eggs: 4 large - fresh spinach: 2 cups - olive oil: 1 tablespoon - garlic (minced): 2 cloves - cherry tomatoes (halved): 1/2 cup - feta cheese (crumbled, optional): 1/4 cup - salt: 1/4 teaspoon - black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon
recipe.directions: 1. Prepare Ingredients: Wash and drain the spinach leaves. Mince the garlic and halve the cherry tomatoes. 2. Cook Garlic: In a non-stick skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and saut√© for about 1 minute until fragrant. 3. Add Spinach: Add the spinach to the skillet and cook until it starts to wilt, about 2-3 minutes. 4. Scramble the Eggs: In a bowl, whisk the eggs with salt and pepper. Pour the eggs over the spinach in the skillet. Allow the eggs to sit for a few seconds and then gently stir to create soft curds. 5. Add Tomatoes and Cheese: When the eggs are mostly set but still slightly runny, stir in the cherry tomatoes and optional feta cheese. Cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until the eggs are fully cooked but remain soft and creamy. 6. Serve: Remove from heat and serve immediately. Enjoy a hearty and healthy start to your day!
recipe.nutrition: Total Cholesterol: 186mg, Total Carbohydrate: 5g, Dietary Fiber: 1g, Sodium: 430mg, Saturated Fat: 3g, Total Fat: 14g, Protein: 14g, Added Sugars: 0g, Total Sugars: 2g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe : Approximately 715 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient: Eggs: 286 calories for 4 large Spinach: 14 calories for 2 cups Olive Oil: 119 calories per tablespoon Garlic: 9 calories per 2 cloves Cherry Tomatoes: 16 calories per 1/2 cup Feta Cheese: 99 calories per 1/4 cup Salt, Black Pepper: Negligible - Serving People: 2
